justification: "Prospective participants completed the Eating Attitudes Test (EAT-26; Garner et al., 1982), where higher scores indicate greater concerns about eating."
The materials list includes the "Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire (EDE-Q)" among the tools used to measure eating-related attitudes and behaviours.
The questionnaire battery contained the "Appearance Anxiety Inventory (AAI)" to assess body-image/appearance anxiety.
Participants completed the "Clinical Impairment Assessment (CIA)"â€”a scale designed to quantify impairment associated with eating-disorder symptoms.
The materials section lists the "State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)" as the instrument used to assess participants' anxiety levels.
Depression was measured with the "Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II)" included in the questionnaire set.
To capture "sensitivity towards uncertainty," the study administered the "Intolerance for Uncertainty Scale (IUS)."
Obsessive-compulsive traits were evaluated using the "Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory (OCI)" as stated in the materials list.
